name: Green
properties: It contains vitamins A, C, and K, iron, antioxidants such as carotenoids and flavonoids, chlorophyll, lutein, zeaxanthin, and folate.
It helps with lowering the risk of cancer, lowering blood pressure, and LDL cholesterol levels, maintaining retinal (eye) health and boosting immunity.
Green fruits and veggies contain lots of fiber to help digestion.
They are rich in lutein, isothiocyanates, isoflavones, and vitamin K  and calcium which is essential for blood and bone health.
Rich in folate, important for pregnant women to consume to help prevent congenital disabilities.

name: Orange/Yellow
properties: Orange contains antioxidants including beta-cryptoxanthin and beta-carotene which converts to vitamin A.
It is helpful in eye and skin health, maintain respiratory health, help arthritis, and lower the risk of certain cancers, and immune systems.
Citrus fruits contain a phytonutrient called hesperidin, which helps to increase blood flow.
Eating an orange a day may help keep your hands and feet warm.
Consuming citrus may also reduce your risk of stroke.
Yellow contain antioxidants such as carotenoids and bioflavonoids.
Carotenoids protect us from diseases such as cancer, retinal disease, and heart disease.
Bioflavonoids strengthen the collagen of our skin, tendons, ligaments, and cartilages.
Yellow foods have lots of vitamin C which acts as an anti-inflammatory agent.

name: Purple/Blue
properties: It contains phytochemicals known as anthocyanins and resveratrol.
Anthocyanins are anti-inflammatory and anti-carcinogenic and lower the risk of diabetes, obesity, and cardiovascular disease.
Resveratrol has disease preventing and anti-aging properties and reduce inflammation, cholesterol, and risk of cancer and Alzheimerâ€™s disease.
It also contains lutein, vitamin C, quercetin and benefits our immune system, overall health, and longevity.

name: Red
properties: Red foods contain beta-carotene (vitamin A), fiber, and the antioxidants quercetin, vitamin C, and lycopene.
Protect the body from free radicals, cancer, and heart disease and aid gastrointestinal health.
Phytochemicals, including lycopene and ellagic acid having cancer-fighting effects.
Watermelon is even higher in lycopene than tomatoes.
Citrulline in watermelon, helpful in treating mild to moderate erectile dysfunction.
Strawberries prevent and even reverse esophageal cancer.

name: White/Brown
properties: It contains anthoxanthins which help lower cholesterol and blood pressure, sulfur which detoxifies our liver and helps with protein structure and skin health, allicin which has anti-tumor properties, and quercetin which has anti-inflammatory properties.
Broccoli, Cauliflower is a cruciferous vegetable rich in an anti-cancer compound called sulforaphane.
Garlic and onions contain the powerful cancer-fighting compounds allicin and quercetin.
Phytonutrients in white button mushrooms found to inhibit aromatase activity and breast cancer cell proliferation.
White foods also boost our immunity and help us avoid weight gain.
You should avoid white processed and refined food.
